head.supplied: Botanic Garden ¶ Melbourne, 28/4/73 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of 26th inst., ¶ received only this day at noon, in reply to which I beg to inform you, that ...

div.p: L73/7685, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by Georg Luehmann and signed by M. Botanic Garden

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of 26th inst.,
get copy from outwards
received only this day at noon, in reply to which I beg to inform you, that I had already previous to the recent and current correspondence on the subject of supply made arrangements with the Committee of the Hospital for Children to supply as usual plants and flowers for the bazaar to be opened to day in the Melbourne townhall. The plants have already been sent for this morning, while some flowers were to be supplied every day during the week.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

div.p:
The Honorable the Commissioner of Lands and Survey.
MS initialled by Casey on 29 April 1873.
